line.words: Je tourne à droite après la boutique, à gauche après la poste, et devant moi il y a une rivière, et quelqu’un me suit.

subtitle.line: I turn right by a shop, left at the post office and in front of me there is a river, and someone follows me.
I turn right by a shop, left at the post office and in front of me there is a river, and someone follows me.

line.words: Je traverse le passage piéton en face du musée, près de l’église et derrière l’école, et quelqu’un me suit.

line.words: Je marche avec mes amis près de la gare. Ils prennent le train ou le bus ou un taxi. Je continue à pied, seul(e), et quelqu’un me suit.

subtitle.line: I walk with my friends near to the train station. They go by train or by bus or by taxi. I continue in foot by myself and someone follows me.
I walk with my friends near to the train station. They go by train or by bus or by taxi. I continue in foot by myself and someone follows me.
Camino con mis amigos cerca de la estación de trenes. Van en tren o en autobús o en taxi. Continuo a pie solo y alguien me sigue.

أمشي مع أصدقائي بالقرب من محطة القطار. يذهبون عن طريق القطار أو الباص أو بواسطة سيارات الأجرة. أواصل أنا السيرعلى ألاقدام لوحدي و أحدهم يتبعوني.

I walk with my friends near to the train station. They go by train or by bus or by taxi. I continue in foot by myself and someone follows me.

line.words: Droit devant, à l’angle, loin de la maison je me retourne. §Salut minou§ dis-je. §Je ferais mieux de te ramener à la maison. Demain je pense que je prendrai le bus.§

subtitle.line: Straight ahead, on the corner, far from home I turn around. “Hello puss,” I say. I better take you home. Tomorrow I think I am going to go by bus.
Straight ahead, on the corner, far from home I turn around. “Hello puss,” I say. I better take you home. Tomorrow I think I am going to go by bus.
Todo recto, en la esquina, lejos de casa giro. “Hola gatito,” digo. “Mejor te llevo a casa. Mañana creo que voy a ir en autobús.”
